metadata.feature_description: Displays top community contributors with their engagement metrics and avatars

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Display top users with avatars in Community Analytics

steps.action: Navigate to PersonaBar > Dashboard > Community Analytics
steps.expected: Community Analytics dashboard should display with a Top Users section showing top community contributors with avatars
steps.actual: Community Analytics dashboard displayed but NO 'Top Community Users' section was found. The dashboard shows modules for Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, and Wiki with Community Health, Engagement, Creates & Views, Trending Tags, and Popular Content sections - but no Top Users section

steps.action: Scroll through the entire Community Analytics dashboard to find Top Users section
steps.expected: Top Users section should be visible somewhere in the Community Analytics panel
steps.actual: Scrolled through entire dashboard - the Top Users section does not exist in the current UI implementation

issues: The 'Top Community Users Display' feature is not present in the Community Analytics dashboard. The feature specification mentions files like 'admin/personaBar/scripts/koComponents/communityUsers.js' but this component is not rendered in the current UI.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Navigate to user profiles on click

steps.action: Locate Top Users section in Community Analytics to test profile navigation
steps.expected: Top Users section should be visible with clickable user entries
steps.actual: Top Users section does not exist in Community Analytics - cannot test profile navigation from this location

issues: Cannot test user profile navigation because the Top Community Users section does not exist in the UI

steps.action: Locate Top Users section in Community Analytics to view contribution metrics
steps.expected: Top Users section should display engagement metrics for each user
steps.actual: Top Users section does not exist in Community Analytics. User contribution metrics (Rank, Reputation, Experience, Engagement, Influence, Total Contributions) ARE available in the separate Manage > Users section when clicking 'User Activity' for individual users, but not in a ranked 'Top Users' display within Community Analytics

issues: User contribution metrics exist in Manage > Users > User Activity panel but NOT in a 'Top Community Users' display within Community Analytics as specified

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test empty state when no users

steps.action: Verify empty state handling for Top Users section
steps.expected: Top Users section should show appropriate empty state message when no users have activity
steps.actual: Cannot test empty state because the Top Users section does not exist in the UI

issues: Cannot test empty state because the feature UI does not exist

steps.action: Verify avatar display and fallback behavior in Top Users section
steps.expected: Users without custom avatars should show default avatar fallback
steps.actual: Cannot test avatar fallback in Top Users section because it does not exist. Default avatar fallback is visible in the separate Manage > Users list

issues: Cannot test avatar fallback in Top Community Users section because the feature does not exist in the UI. Avatar fallback works in the general Users management panel.

observations: The 'Top Community Users Display' feature as described (showing top community contributors with their engagement metrics and avatars in a dedicated section within Community Analytics) does NOT exist in the current UI implementation.

The Community Analytics dashboard shows modules for Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, and Wiki - each with Community Health, Engagement, Creates & Views, Trending Tags, and Popular Content sections - but NO 'Top Users' or 'Top Community Users' section.

User contribution metrics (Rank, Reputation, Experience, Engagement, Influence, Total Contributions) ARE available in the Manage > Users section when viewing individual 'User Activity', but this is NOT the same as a ranked 'Top Community Users' display.

The feature specification references files like 'admin/personaBar/scripts/koComponents/communityUsers.js' which suggests the code may exist, but the source repository was empty and the UI component is not rendered.
This may indicate the feature was planned but not fully implemented, or it has been removed/hidden in the current version.
